title: Mommsen’s reconstruction of the entry in the Fasti Praenestini reads as follows: Frequenter mulieres supplicant [honestiores Veneri Verticordiae] fortunae virili, humiliores etiam in balneis, quod in iis ea parte corpor[is] utique viri nudantur, qua feminarum gratia desideratur. See Scullard 1981:96. For the original calendar see A.Degrassi 1963: Table 40. Verrius Flaccus’ account is most usefully analysed in conjunction with Ovid’s exegesis

title: The ritual washing of a cult statue was in itself unexceptional. What is striking about this cult is that the worshippers bathed themselves too, in apparent imitation of the washing of the cult statue
